section.title: BBC Sport | Sport Homepage | UK Edition
section.p: New captain Steven Gerrard says England will be fully prepared for their first World Cup match despite the loss of Rio Ferdinand.

p.link: England on top despite Tamim ton

section.p: Tamim Iqbal hits 108 but Bangladesh are bowled out for 216, 203 runs behind England, on day two of the second Test at Old Trafford.
Francesca Schiavone beats Australia's Sam Stosur in the French Open final to become the first Italian woman to win a Grand Slam singles title.
Workforce, trained by Sir Michael Stoute and ridden by Ryan Moore, wins the Derby by seven lengths with a record run at Epsom.
South Africa secure a narrow 34-31 victory in Cardiff as Wales miss out on only a second win in 104 years against the Springboks.
Didier Drogba undergoes a "successful" operation on his fractured arm, but the Ivory Coast star's World Cup participation remains in doubt.

p.link: Injured Robben a World Cup doubt

section.p: Dutch winger Arjen Robben is a major doubt for the World Cup finals after limping off during his country's 6-1 friendly victory over Hungary.

p.link: Nigeria's Mikel out of World Cup

section.p: Nigeria midfielder John Mikel Obi is ruled out of the World Cup with a knee injury.
Former Chelsea boss Guus Hiddink is highly unlikely to become the new manager of Liverpool, according to the Dutchman's agent, Cees van Nieuwenhuizen.
Manchester City complete the signing of German defender Jerome Boateng from Hamburg.
Valentino Rossi could be out for up to six months after suffering a compound fracture of his right leg in practice for the Italian MotoGP.
Four-time champion Rafael Nadal insists revenge is not on his mind as he prepares to take on his 2009 conqueror Robin Soderling in the French Open final on Sunday.

p.link: Siem closes in on Wales Open win

section.p: Germany's Marcel Siem leads by three shots after day three of the Wales Open at Celtic Manor.
Latest scores from the Memorial Tournament at Muirfield Village, Ohio, as Tiger Woods defends his title.

p.link: Cawthorn eases to gold in Germany

section.p: Britain's Rachel Cawthorn wins gold in the women's K1 1,000m at the final World Cup event in Germany.
